decision_conditions: The proposed amendment to the planning condition is considered to be non-material in effect and as such falls under the remit of Section 96a of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990.In respect of application reference 19/03044/FUL, condition 3 (Facial Materials) will now be worded as the following: The development shall be completed in accordance with the following details which shall have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, before building operations commence. (a) details of all rooflights (including their manufacturer's specification, colour andtexture). Reason: These details are required prior to commencement of development because the details would affect subsequent design of other elements of the scheme and must be agreed at the outset and to ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of thedevelopment in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) and DM12 (Development in Conservation Areas and Affecting Heritage Assets) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.
description: Non-Material Amendment to Planning Permission ref: 19/03044/FUL (Application to vary condition 1 (Approved Plans) of Planning Application 19/01509/HOU dated 06/08/2019 (Demolition of existing single storey side extension and erection of single storey side extension) to allow provision of one additional window to flank elevation). Amendment requesting non submission of physical materials to discharge planning condition 3
